title: JavaScript Fundamentals
description: Learn Modern JavaScript (2023) in Tamil from beginners and become experts!

videos.title: #01  What is JavaScript - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course
#02  - Why we should learn JavaScript - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: JavaScript Ecosystem Research
task.problemStatement:
Research and document: 
 1) Why JavaScript is the most used programming language, 
 2) List 5 popular JavaScript frameworks/libraries (React, Vue, etc), 
 3) Create a simple comparison table showing where JavaScript is used (Web, Mobile, Backend, Desktop).

videos.title: #03 -  How JavaScript works  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: JavaScript Execution Model
task.problemStatement:
Explain the JavaScript execution flow: 
 1) Parsing and Compilation, 
 2) Execution Context and Call Stack, 
 3) Demonstrate hoisting behavior, 
 4) Show how the Event Loop processes callbacks. Include code with console logs showing the order of execution.

videos.title: #04 ECMAScript vs JavaScript - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Practice: ECMAScript vs JavaScript
task.problemStatement: Recreate the example shown in the video titled "#04 ECMAScript vs JavaScript - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course" and explain the key points.

videos.title: #05 Setting up JavaScript development environment  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Practice: Setting up JavaScript development environment
task.problemStatement: Recreate the example shown in the video titled "#05 Setting up JavaScript development environment  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course" and explain the key points.

videos.title: #06  Building our first JavaScript application  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Practice: Building your first JavaScript application
task.problemStatement: Create a simple JavaScript application that displays 'Hello, World!' in the console and on a webpage.

videos.title: #07  JavaScript comments & why is it important?  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Practice: Write JavaScript comments in code
task.problemStatement: With previous code examples, add appropriate single-line and multi-line comments explaining the purpose of functions, variables, and logic used.

videos.title: #08 - Coding JavaScript in proper way  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course
#09 - Running JavaScript in Node  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Practice: Running JavaScript in Node
task.problemStatement: Write javascript and run simple scripts using Node.js. Create a script that logs current date and time, and another that reads a text file and prints its contents to the console.

videos.title: #10 - JavaScript Variables  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Declare and Use Variables
task.problemStatement: Create a program that declares variables for storing a person's name, age, and email address. Assign appropriate values to each variable and display them in a formatted output.

challenges.title: Multiple Variable Declarations
challenges.description: Declare 5 different variables using var, let, and const and log them all

challenges.title: Variable Reassignment
challenges.description: Create a variable, assign it a value, then reassign it to a different value and display both

challenges.title: Variable Naming Convention
challenges.description: Practice using camelCase naming convention for multiple variables

videos.title: #11 - JavaScript Constants  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Working with Constants
task.problemStatement: Define constants for mathematical values (PI, E) and application settings. Try to understand why constants are important for values that should not change.

challenges.title: Constant vs Variable
challenges.description: Compare const and let by attempting to reassign a const and observing the error

challenges.title: Object Constants
challenges.description: Create a const object and modify its properties (showing immutability vs property mutability)

challenges.title: Array Constants
challenges.description: Create a const array and add/remove elements to understand const behavior with mutable objects

videos.title: #12 - JavaScript Datatypes - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Identify and Use Datatypes
task.problemStatement: Create variables of different JavaScript datatypes: string, number, boolean, null, undefined, object, and symbol. Log each variable with its type using typeof operator.
task.expectedOutput:
string: "Hello" - type: string
number: 42 - type: number
boolean: true - type: boolean
null: null - type: object
undefined: undefined - type: undefined

challenges.title: Type Checking
challenges.description: Create a function that accepts different datatypes and returns their type

challenges.title: Datatype Conversion
challenges.description: Convert between different datatypes (string to number, number to boolean, etc.)

challenges.title: typeof vs instanceof
challenges.description: Demonstrate the difference between typeof and instanceof operators

videos.title: #13 - JavaScript Dynamic Typing  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Understand Dynamic Typing
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate dynamic typing by creating a variable and assigning it different datatypes in sequence. Log the variable and its type after each assignment to show how JavaScript allows type changes.
task.expectedOutput:
Initial: 10, Type: number
After reassignment: "Hello", Type: string
After reassignment: true, Type: boolean

challenges.title: Type Coercion
challenges.description: Show examples of implicit type coercion in JavaScript operations

challenges.title: Comparison Operators
challenges.description: Demonstrate loose equality (==) vs strict equality (===) with different types

challenges.title: Dynamic Behavior
challenges.description: Create a function that processes the same variable when it has different types

videos.title: #14 - JavaScript Objects  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Create and Manipulate Objects
task.problemStatement: Create a student object with properties for name, rollNumber, grade, and courses array. Add methods to calculate GPA and display student information.
task.expectedOutput:
Student: John, Roll: 101, Grade: A
Courses: JavaScript, React, Node.js
GPA: 3.8

challenges.title: Object Methods
challenges.description: Add multiple methods to the object and invoke them with proper context

challenges.title: Nested Objects
challenges.description: Create objects with nested properties and access deeply nested values

challenges.title: Object Iteration
challenges.description: Iterate through object properties using for-in, Object.keys(), and Object.entries()

videos.title: #15 - JavaScript Arrays  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Working with Arrays
task.problemStatement: Create an array of numbers and perform operations like adding elements, removing elements, finding maximum/minimum values, and calculating the sum of all elements.
task.expectedOutput:
Original: [1, 5, 3, 9, 2]
After adding 7: [1, 5, 3, 9, 2, 7]
Max: 9, Min: 1, Sum: 27

challenges.title: Array Methods
challenges.description: Use map, filter, reduce, and forEach to manipulate arrays

challenges.title: Array Transformation
challenges.description: Transform an array of objects (students) and extract specific properties

challenges.title: Multi-dimensional Arrays
challenges.description: Create and manipulate a 2D array (matrix) and access nested elements

videos.title: #16 - JavaScript Functions - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Define and Use Functions
task.problemStatement: Create functions to calculate area of circle, rectangle, and triangle. Each function should accept parameters and return the calculated area. Also create a main function that calls all these functions.
task.expectedOutput:
Circle area (r=5): 78.5
Rectangle area (l=4, w=6): 24
Triangle area (b=5, h=8): 20

challenges.title: Function Expressions
challenges.description: Rewrite function declarations as function expressions and arrow functions

challenges.title: Higher Order Functions
challenges.description: Create functions that return functions or accept functions as parameters

challenges.title: Recursion
challenges.description: Write recursive functions to calculate factorial or Fibonacci number

videos.title: Question: Why are we learning basics? - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course
#17 - JavaScript Operators - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Perform Arithmetic Operations
task.problemStatement: Create a calculator program that demonstrates all arithmetic operators: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, modulus, and exponentiation. Show results for various number combinations.

challenges.title: Order of Operations
challenges.description: Demonstrate operator precedence with complex expressions

challenges.title: Increment and Decrement
challenges.description: Show differences between pre-increment (++x) and post-increment (x++)

challenges.title: Mathematical Expressions
challenges.description: Solve complex mathematical formulas using arithmetic operators

videos.title: #19 - JavaScript Assignment Operators - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Use Assignment Operators
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate all assignment operators (=, +=, -=, *=, /=, %=, **=) with practical examples. Show how compound assignment operators modify variables efficiently.
task.expectedOutput:
Initial value: 10
After += 5: 15
After -= 3: 12
After *= 2: 24
After /= 4: 6
After %= 4: 2

challenges.title: Variable Updates
challenges.description: Create a system where variables are updated multiple times with different assignment operators

challenges.title: Destructuring Assignment
challenges.description: Use destructuring assignment with arrays and objects

challenges.title: Spread Operator
challenges.description: Understand and use the spread operator with assignment

videos.title: #18 - JavaScript Arithmetic Operators - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Master Arithmetic Operations
task.problemStatement: Build a utility that takes two numbers and performs all arithmetic operations. Handle edge cases like division by zero and ensure accurate calculations with proper formatting.
task.expectedOutput:
Results for a=20, b=3:
Addition: 23
Subtraction: 17
Multiplication: 60
Division: 6.67
Modulus: 2

challenges.title: Compound Assignment
challenges.description: Use +=, -=, *=, /= operators in calculations

challenges.title: Number Precision
challenges.description: Handle floating-point precision issues in arithmetic operations

challenges.title: String to Number Conversion
challenges.description: Convert string inputs to numbers and perform arithmetic operations

videos.title: #20 - JavaScript Comparison Operators - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Compare Values with Comparison Operators
task.problemStatement: Create a comparison utility that demonstrates all comparison operators (>, <, >=, <=) with different datatypes. Show results as true/false for various comparisons.

challenges.title: Type Comparison
challenges.description: Compare values of different types (string vs number) and understand type coercion

challenges.title: Null and Undefined
challenges.description: Compare null and undefined with various values

challenges.title: String Comparison
challenges.description: Understand lexicographic ordering in string comparisons

videos.title: #21 - JavaScript Equality Operators - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Understand Equality Operators
task.problemStatement: Compare loose equality (==) and strict equality (===) operators with various values. Show how == performs type coercion while === checks both value and type.
task.expectedOutput:
5 == '5': true (loose equality with type coercion)
5 === '5': false (strict equality, different types)
Null == undefined: true
Null === undefined: false

challenges.title: Inequality Operators
challenges.description: Demonstrate != vs !== operators with practical examples

challenges.title: Object Equality
challenges.description: Compare object references and understand reference equality

challenges.title: Array Comparison
challenges.description: Show why two arrays with same elements are not equal using == or ===

videos.title: #22 - JavaScript Ternary Operator - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Use Ternary Operator for Conditional Logic
task.problemStatement: Replace if-else statements with ternary operators in practical scenarios. Create functions that determine grade based on marks, eligibility based on age, and discount based on purchase amount.
task.expectedOutput:
Score 85: Grade A
Age 25: Eligible
Amount 5000: Discount 10%

challenges.title: Nested Ternary
challenges.description: Use nested ternary operators for multiple conditions (while keeping code readable)

challenges.title: Ternary with Functions
challenges.description: Return different functions using ternary operator

challenges.title: Assignment with Ternary
challenges.description: Assign values to variables using ternary operator based on conditions

videos.title: #23 - JavaScript Logical Operator - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Work with Logical Operators
task.problemStatement: Create a program that uses logical operators (AND, OR, NOT) to validate user input. Check if age is between 18-60, if email contains '@', and if password length is >= 8 characters.
task.expectedOutput:
Age (25) in range: true
Email valid: true
Password strong: true
All conditions met: true

challenges.title: Operator Precedence
challenges.description: Demonstrate how AND has higher precedence than OR

challenges.title: Short-circuit Evaluation
challenges.description: Show how logical operators short-circuit (stop evaluating when result is determined)

challenges.title: Complex Logic
challenges.description: Build complex validation logic combining multiple logical operators

videos.title: #24 - JavaScript Logical Operator with Non Boolean Values - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Logical Operators with Truthy and Falsy Values
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate how logical operators work with truthy and falsy values. Show how AND returns the first falsy value or the last value, and how OR returns the first truthy value.

challenges.title: Default Values
challenges.description: Use || operator to provide default values for undefined or null variables

challenges.title: Nullish Coalescing
challenges.description: Use ?? operator to distinguish between null/undefined and falsy values

challenges.title: Logical Assignment
challenges.description: Use &&=, ||=, and ??= operators for conditional assignment

videos.title: #25 - JavaScript BitWise  Operators - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Perform Bitwise Operations
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate bitwise operators (AND, OR, XOR, NOT, left shift, right shift) with binary representations. Show how these operators work at the bit level for optimization.

challenges.title: Binary Representation
challenges.description: Convert numbers to binary and explain bitwise operation results

challenges.title: Bit Manipulation
challenges.description: Check if specific bits are set, toggle bits, or clear bits using bitwise operators

challenges.title: Performance Optimization
challenges.description: Use bitwise operations for flags or efficient calculations

videos.title: #26 - JavaScript Operator Precedence - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Understand Operator Precedence and Associativity
task.problemStatement: Create expressions that demonstrate operator precedence. Show how multiplication is evaluated before addition, how exponentiation is right-associative, and how parentheses override precedence.

challenges.title: Complex Expressions
challenges.description: Build complex expressions and predict results using precedence rules

challenges.title: Logical Operator Precedence
challenges.description: Understand precedence of AND, OR, and NOT operators

challenges.title: Associativity Rules
challenges.description: Demonstrate left-associative and right-associative operators

videos.title: #27 - JavaScript If-Else (With Examples) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Control Flow with If-Else Statements
task.problemStatement: Create a program that evaluates student performance using if-else statements. Assign grades (A: >=90, B: >=80, C: >=70, D: >=60, F: <60) based on marks and provide feedback for each grade.
task.expectedOutput:
Marks: 85
Grade: B
Feedback: Good performance, aim for A grade next time

challenges.title: Nested If-Else
challenges.description: Use nested if-else for complex multi-level conditions

challenges.title: Switch Statement
challenges.description: Convert if-else logic to switch-case statement

challenges.title: Early Return
challenges.description: Use early returns in functions to simplify complex if-else chains

videos.title: #28 - JavaScript Switch-case (With Examples) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Grade Calculator using Switch Statement
task.problemStatement: Write a function that takes a score (0-100) and returns a grade letter (A, B, C, D, F) using switch-case statement. A: 90-100, B: 80-89, C: 70-79, D: 60-69, F: 0-59

challenges.title: Day of Week Converter
challenges.description: Convert number (1-7) to day name (Monday-Sunday) using switch-case

challenges.title: Traffic Light Action
challenges.description: Return the appropriate action for traffic light colors (Red: Stop, Yellow: Wait, Green: Go) using switch

challenges.title: Calculator with Switch
challenges.description: Create a calculator function that takes two numbers and an operator (+, -, *, /) using switch-case

videos.title: #29 - JavaScript For Loops (With Example) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Print Multiplication Table
task.problemStatement: Write a function using for loop to print multiplication table for a given number up to 10. For example, print 5 × 1 = 5, 5 × 2 = 10, ... 5 × 10 = 50

challenges.title: Sum of Numbers
challenges.description: Calculate the sum of numbers from 1 to n using a for loop

challenges.title: Factorial Calculator
challenges.description: Calculate factorial of a number using for loop (5! = 5×4×3×2×1 = 120)

challenges.title: Nested Loop Pattern
challenges.description: Print a pyramid pattern using nested for loops (e.g., * to ***** for 5 rows)

videos.title: #30 - JavaScript While Loop - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Count Down Timer
task.problemStatement: Write a function using while loop that counts down from a given number n to 1 and returns all numbers as a string separated by commas

challenges.title: Input Validation Loop
challenges.description: Keep asking for input until user enters a valid number between 1 and 100 using while loop

challenges.title: Sum Until Threshold
challenges.description: Add numbers starting from 1 until the sum exceeds a threshold value using while loop

challenges.title: String Reversal
challenges.description: Reverse a string by removing characters from the end one by one using while loop

videos.title: #31 - JavaScript Do-While Loop - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Menu Selection Handler
task.problemStatement: Create a menu system that displays options and executes at least once using do-while loop. The loop should continue until user selects 'Exit'
task.expectedOutput: Menu shown at least once, repeats based on selection until exit option chosen

challenges.title: Password Validation
challenges.description: Keep prompting for password until correct password is entered using do-while loop

challenges.title: Dice Roll Game
challenges.description: Roll a dice (random 1-6) and keep rolling until you get 6 using do-while loop

challenges.title: Number Guessing Game
challenges.description: Implement a guessing game that plays at least once and continues until correct number is guessed

videos.title: #32 - JavaScript For..in Loop - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Object Property Printer
task.problemStatement: Write a function that uses for..in loop to iterate through all properties of an object and return a string with property names and values formatted as 'key: value'

challenges.title: Sum Object Values
challenges.description: Sum all numeric values in an object using for..in loop

challenges.title: Filter Object Properties
challenges.description: Create a new object containing only properties with values greater than a threshold using for..in

challenges.title: Nested Object Iterator
challenges.description: Iterate through nested objects using for..in and collect all leaf values

videos.title: #33 - JavaScript For..of Loop - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Array Element Processor
task.problemStatement: Write a function using for..of loop to iterate through an array of numbers and return the sum of all elements

challenges.title: String Character Counter
challenges.description: Count specific character occurrences in a string using for..of loop

challenges.title: Array Transformation
challenges.description: Transform each element in an array (e.g., square each number) and return new array using for..of

challenges.title: Find Maximum Value
challenges.description: Find the maximum value in an array of numbers using for..of loop

videos.title: #34 - How to fix Infinite Loop in JavaScript (Solution) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Debug Infinite Loop
task.problemStatement: Identify and fix infinite loops by ensuring loop counter is updated and exit condition is properly defined. Implement a corrected version of common infinite loop patterns
task.expectedOutput: Fixed loop terminates correctly with proper output after iterations

challenges.title: Missing Increment Fix
challenges.description: Fix a for loop where counter is not incremented, causing infinite loop

challenges.title: Wrong Condition Fix
challenges.description: Fix a while loop with incorrect exit condition that creates infinite loop

challenges.title: Break Statement Implementation
challenges.description: Add proper break statements to exit infinite loops in various scenarios

videos.title: #35 - JavaScript Object & OOP(Object Oriented Programming) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Create User Object
task.problemStatement: Create a user object with properties (name, email, age) and methods (getInfo() returns formatted string, updateAge() updates the age). Demonstrate basic OOP principles

challenges.title: Rectangle Class
challenges.description: Create a Rectangle object with width, height properties and methods for area and perimeter calculation

challenges.title: Bank Account Object
challenges.description: Create a BankAccount object with balance, deposit() and withdraw() methods with validation

challenges.title: Student Grade Calculator
challenges.description: Create a Student object that calculates average grade and returns grade letter using methods

videos.title: #36 - JavaScript Factory Functions - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Create Person Factory
task.problemStatement: Write a factory function that creates person objects with properties (name, age) and methods (greet() returns greeting). Call it multiple times to create different person instances
task.expectedOutput: person1.greet() → 'Hello, I am John', person2.greet() → 'Hello, I am Sarah'

challenges.title: Car Factory Function
challenges.description: Create a factory function that produces car objects with brand, model, year and methods

challenges.title: Todo Factory with Methods
challenges.description: Create a factory function that produces todo items with title, completed status and toggle method

challenges.title: Product Factory with Pricing
challenges.description: Create a factory function for products with methods to calculate discount and final price

videos.title: #37 - JavaScript Constructor Functions - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Create Person Constructor
task.problemStatement: Write a constructor function Person that takes name and age as parameters. Add a method introduce() using prototype. Create instances with 'new' keyword
task.expectedOutput: new Person('John', 25).introduce() → 'I am John and 25 years old'

challenges.title: Animal Constructor
challenges.description: Create an Animal constructor with species and sound properties, add a method to make sound

challenges.title: Circle Constructor with Area
challenges.description: Create a Circle constructor with radius property and methods to calculate area and circumference

challenges.title: Book Constructor with Prototype
challenges.description: Create a Book constructor and add multiple methods via prototype for getting info and updating details

videos.title: #38 - JavaScript's Dynamic Nature of Objects - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Add Properties Dynamically
task.problemStatement: Create an object and dynamically add/remove properties and methods at runtime. Demonstrate bracket notation and adding methods after object creation
task.expectedOutput: obj.newProperty = 'value' works, obj['key'] = 'data' works, methods added dynamically execute correctly

challenges.title: Configuration Builder
challenges.description: Build a configuration object by dynamically adding properties based on conditions

challenges.title: Dynamic Method Binding
challenges.description: Create functions dynamically and attach them as object methods at runtime

challenges.title: Object Property Cloner
challenges.description: Copy properties from one object to another dynamically, including methods

videos.title: #39 - JavaScript Constructor Property - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Verify Constructor Property
task.problemStatement: Create objects using constructor functions and verify the constructor property using obj.constructor. Demonstrate how constructor property references the original constructor function

challenges.title: Type Checker Function
challenges.description: Write a function that identifies the constructor type of any given object

challenges.title: Object Cloning
challenges.description: Clone an object using its constructor property to create a new instance of the same type

challenges.title: Constructor Property Restoration
challenges.description: Create objects where constructor property is lost and restore it correctly

videos.title: #40 - JavaScript Functions are Objects - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Functions Objects: Functions as objects
task.problemStatement:
Demonstrate functions as first-class objects: 
1) Add properties to functions,
2) Use functions as properties in objects, 
3) Pass functions as arguments, 
4) Return functions from functions (higher-order), 
5) Store functions in variables and arrays. Show practical patterns like decorators and callbacks.

challenges.title: Function Counter
challenges.description: Create function with property to count how many times it's called. Use function.property to track invocations.

challenges.title: Higher-Order Functions
challenges.description: Implement functions that return other functions: multiplier(x) returns function that multiplies by x, compose functions, etc.

challenges.title: Function Decorator Pattern
challenges.description: Create decorators using higher-order functions: addLogging(fn), addTiming(fn), addValidation(fn) that wrap functions.

videos.title: #41 - JavaScript Primitive value types vs reference types  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Value vs Reference: Pass by value/reference
task.problemStatement:
Demonstrate primitives vs references: 
1) Show primitives (number, string, boolean, null, undefined, symbol) passed by value, 
2) Show objects/arrays passed by reference, 
3) Create examples modifying function parameters, 
4) Explain stack vs heap memory. Include common pitfalls and how to handle them properly.

challenges.title: Reference vs Value Visualizer
challenges.description: Create code demonstrating difference: modify primitive in function (no external change), modify object in function (external change reflected).

challenges.title: Safe Object Modification
challenges.description: Create functions that modify objects safely without affecting originals. Use techniques like spread operator, Object.assign(), or cloning.

challenges.title: Memory Management Comparison
challenges.description: Explain and demonstrate memory differences: primitives in stack, objects in heap. Show performance implications of copying.

videos.title: #42 - Enumerating Properties of an Object  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Enumerate Properties: Object.keys/values
task.problemStatement:
Work with object enumeration: 
1) Use Object.keys() to get property names, 
2) Use Object.values() to get property values, 
3) Use Object.entries() for key-value pairs, 
4) Compare with for...in loop, 
5) Handle inherited properties with hasOwnProperty(). Show practical use cases.

challenges.title: Object Printer
challenges.description: Create function that prints all object properties and values in formatted way using Object.entries() or similar.

challenges.title: Object Property Filter
challenges.description: Filter object properties based on conditions: get only numeric values, string values, or values matching pattern.

challenges.title: Object Transformer
challenges.description: Create function using Object.entries() to transform object properties: uppercase keys, square numeric values, etc.

videos.title: #43 - Cloning an JavaScript Object - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Cloning Objects: Shallow and deep clone
task.problemStatement:
Implement cloning techniques: 
1) Shallow clone using Object.assign() or spread operator, 
2) Deep clone for nested objects, 
3) Demonstrate why simple assignment doesn't work, 
4) Compare performance of different methods. Show when each approach is appropriate. Include circular reference handling.

challenges.title: Shallow Clone Implementation
challenges.description: Create shallowClone() function using Object.assign() or spread. Show it copies top-level but nested objects still reference original.

challenges.title: Deep Clone Implementation
challenges.description: Implement deepClone() function recursively or using JSON methods. Handle nested objects and arrays properly.

challenges.title: Clone with Special Cases
challenges.description: Create clone function that handles special cases: Dates, Functions, circular references, symbols.

videos.title: #44 - JavaScript Garbage Collection - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Garbage Collection: Memory management
task.problemStatement:
Explain garbage collection: 
1) How JavaScript manages memory automatically, 
2) Demonstrate memory leaks (circular references, forgotten listeners), 
3) Show how to prevent leaks (nullify references, remove listeners), 
4) Discuss mark-and-sweep algorithm basics. Include practical patterns for cleanup.

challenges.title: Memory Leak Detector
challenges.description: Create examples of potential memory leaks and explain how to fix them: forgotten timers, listeners, circular references.

challenges.title: Cleanup Patterns
challenges.description: Demonstrate proper cleanup patterns: proper event listener removal, clearing timers, nullifying references in closures.

challenges.title: Resource Manager
challenges.description: Create ResourceManager class that tracks resources and provides cleanup method to prevent leaks.

videos.title: #45 - JavaScript Math Object  - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Math Object: Math methods
task.problemStatement:
Explore Math object methods: 
1) Use Math.random() for generating random numbers, 
2) Use Math.floor/ceil/round for rounding, 
3) Use Math.max/min for comparisons, 
4) Use trigonometric methods (sin, cos), 
5) Implement practical functions like random range generator, dice roller, percentage calculator.

challenges.title: Random Utilities
challenges.description: Create utility functions: randomInteger(min, max), randomFloat(min, max), randomFromArray(arr), randomColor().

challenges.title: Math Applications
challenges.description: Build functions using Math: calculate circle area, distance between points, calculate percentage, temperature converter.

challenges.title: Game Mechanics
challenges.description: Create game mechanics using Math: dice rolling, random enemy position, score calculation, collision detection.

videos.title: #46 - JavaScript String Object  - (தமிழील்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: String Object: String methods
task.problemStatement:
Master String methods: 
1) Use charAt, charCodeAt for character access, 
2) Use slice, substring, substr for extraction, 
3) Use indexOf, lastIndexOf for searching, 
4) Use split, replace, trim for manipulation, 
5) Use toUpperCase, toLowerCase for case, 
6) Use concat, padStart/padEnd. Include practical text processing examples.

challenges.title: String Manipulator
challenges.description: Create functions: capitalize(str), reverse(str), countVowels(str), isPalindrome(str) using various String methods.

challenges.title: Text Processor
challenges.description: Build text processing: trim whitespace, replace words, format strings with padding, extract email domain.

challenges.title: Password Validator
challenges.description: Create validator checking password requirements using string methods: length, uppercase, lowercase, numbers, special characters.

videos.title: #47 - JavaScript Template Literals - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Template Literals: String interpolation
task.problemStatement:
Work with template literals: 
1) Use backticks and ${} for interpolation, 
2) Create multi-line strings, 
3) Include expressions in templates, 
4) Use tagged templates for custom processing, 
5) Compare with string concatenation. Show readability improvements and advanced patterns.

challenges.title: HTML Generator
challenges.description: Create functions generating HTML using template literals: createUserCard(user), createTable(data), etc.

challenges.title: SQL Query Builder
challenges.description: Build SQL queries using template literals safely: SELECT queries, INSERT queries with parameterization.

challenges.title: Tagged Template Processing
challenges.description: Create custom tag functions for templates: highlight(), uppercase(), currency(price), with custom processing.

videos.title: #48 - JavaScript Date Object - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Date Object: Date handling
task.problemStatement:
Work with Date object: 
1) Create and parse dates, 
2) Get year, month, day, hours, minutes, 
3) Calculate time differences, 
4) Format dates for display, 
5) Work with timezones basics. Create practical functions like age calculator, countdown timer, relative date display (e.g., '2 hours ago').

challenges.title: Date Formatter
challenges.description: Create functions: formatDate(date), getAge(birthDate), daysUntil(date), relative time display.

challenges.title: Event Scheduler
challenges.description: Build scheduling functions: isUpcoming(date), isDue(date), getEventsForDay(date, events).

challenges.title: Countdown Timer
challenges.description: Create countdown display showing time remaining to event with days, hours, minutes, seconds.

videos.title: #49 - JavaScript Arrays In-depth - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Arrays In-depth: Array properties
task.problemStatement:
Master array fundamentals: 
1) Understand length property and sparse arrays, 
2) Create arrays with different methods (literal, constructor), 
3) Access elements with indices (positive, negative), 
4) Understand array-like objects, 
5) Use Array.isArray() for type checking. Show internal structure and properties.

challenges.title: Array Inspector
challenges.description: Create function that returns detailed info about array: length, sparse positions, element types, memory usage.

challenges.title: Array Utilities
challenges.description: Build functions: isEmpty(arr), hasDuplicates(arr), getUniqueElements(arr), flattenArray(arr).

challenges.title: Array-like Handler
challenges.description: Work with array-like objects (arguments, NodeList): convert to array, iterate, understand differences from real arrays.

videos.title: #50 - Adding element to an JavaScript Array - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Adding Elements: Push and array methods
task.problemStatement:
Master adding elements: 
1) Use push() to add to end, 
2) Use unshift() to add to beginning, 
3) Use splice() for insertion, 
4) Use concat() for merging, 
5) Use spread operator (...) for adding. Show mutating vs non-mutating methods. Include examples with single and multiple elements.

challenges.title: Smart List Manager
challenges.description: Create ListManager class: add elements, addAtPosition(element, index), addMultiple(elements), with validation.

challenges.title: Immutable Array Builder
challenges.description: Create functions that add elements immutably (returning new array): immutablePush, immutableUnshift using spread.

challenges.title: Array Manipulator
challenges.description: Build functions demonstrating all add methods: compare push vs unshift, splice vs concat, mutating vs non-mutating.

videos.title: #51 - Finding an element in a JavaScript Array [Primitives] - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Finding Primitives: Array search primitives
task.problemStatement:
Search primitive arrays: 
1) Use indexOf() for first occurrence, 
2) Use lastIndexOf() for last occurrence, 
3) Use includes() for existence check, 
4) Use find() with callback, 
5) Use findIndex() for index. Demonstrate differences between methods. Include examples with numbers, strings, booleans.

challenges.title: Element Finder
challenges.description: Create functions: findElement(arr, value), findPosition(arr, value), findAll(arr, value), findClosest(arr, value).

challenges.title: Advanced Filtering
challenges.description: Build functions with conditions: findByRange(arr, min, max), findByType(arr, type), findMatching(arr, pattern).

challenges.title: Search Performance
challenges.description: Compare indexOf vs includes vs find performance. Demonstrate when each method is optimal.

videos.title: #52 - Finding an element in a JavaScript Reference Array - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Finding References: Object array search
task.problemStatement:
Search object arrays: 
1) Use find() with predicate function, 
2) Use findIndex() for index, 
3) Use filter() for multiple matches, 
4) Compare objects by properties, 
5) Handle nested properties. Create practical search functions for complex objects with various criteria.

challenges.title: User Finder
challenges.description: Create functions to find users by name, email, ID, age range: findByName(users, name), findByEmail(users, email).

challenges.title: Advanced Search
challenges.description: Build search functions for complex objects: searchByMultipleFields(users, {name, age}), searchNested(users, criteria).

challenges.title: Sorting and Finding Combined
challenges.description: Combine finding with sorting: getTopMatches(arr, criteria, limit), getByRangeAndSort(arr, range).

videos.title: #53 - JavaScript ES6: Arrow Functions - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Arrow Functions: ES6 syntax
task.problemStatement:
Master arrow functions: 
1) Basic syntax (x => x * 2), 
2) Multi-parameter functions, 
3) Multi-line functions with braces, 
4) Implicit return, 
5) Understand 'this' binding difference. Compare with regular functions. Show use in callbacks, array methods, and practical patterns.

challenges.title: Syntax Conversion
challenges.description: Convert regular functions to arrow functions, understand parameter variations: single param, multiple params, no params.

challenges.title: Array Method Mastery
challenges.description: Use arrow functions with map, filter, reduce, sort: transform array elements, filter by criteria, accumulate values.

challenges.title: This Binding Comparison
challenges.description: Demonstrate difference in 'this' between arrow functions and regular functions. Show practical implications in objects/classes.

videos.title: #54 - Removing an element in an JavaScript Array - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Removing Elements: Array removal
task.problemStatement:
Master element removal: 
1) Use pop() to remove from end, 
2) Use shift() to remove from start, 
3) Use splice() for removal by index, 
4) Use filter() for conditional removal, 
5) Use slice() for non-mutating. Show mutating vs non-mutating approaches. Include examples of removing specific values and conditions.

challenges.title: Array Cleaner
challenges.description: Create functions: removeElement(arr, value), removeAt(arr, index), removeIf(arr, condition), removeDuplicates(arr).

challenges.title: Immutable Removal
challenges.description: Build removal functions that return new arrays without mutating: immutableRemove, immutableRemoveAt, immutableFilter.

challenges.title: Advanced Removal Patterns
challenges.description: Implement removeRange(arr, start, end), removeNulls(arr), removeEmpty(arr), removeByType(arr, type).

videos.title: #55 - Emptying an JavaScript Array - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Emptying Arrays: Clearing arrays
task.problemStatement:
Clear array contents: 
1) Set length to 0, 
2) Use splice(0), 
3) Reassign empty array, 
4) Understand reference implications, 
5) Handle multiple references. Show when each method is appropriate and potential pitfalls with shared references. Include practical cleanup patterns.

challenges.title: Array Clearing Methods
challenges.description: Compare and demonstrate different clearing methods: length = 0, splice(0), = [], mutating vs non-mutating.

challenges.title: Reference Handling
challenges.description: Show how clearing affects multiple references to same array. Demonstrate shared reference behavior and solutions.

challenges.title: Queue/Stack Cleaner
challenges.description: Create queue/stack implementations with proper clearing: clear while preserving structure or capacity.

videos.title: #56 - Combining & Extracting elements in JavaScript Arrays - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Combine and Extract Arrays
task.problemStatement: Write functions to combine multiple arrays together and extract specific portions from arrays using various methods.
task.expectedOutput: Combined arrays and extracted array portions

challenges.title: Combine Multiple Arrays
challenges.description: Create a function that combines 3 or more arrays into a single array. Use both concat() and spread operator methods.

challenges.title: Extract Portion of Array
challenges.description: Write a function that extracts a portion of an array between two indices without modifying the original array.

challenges.title: Merge and Remove Duplicates
challenges.description: Combine multiple arrays and remove duplicate elements. Return a new array with unique values only.

videos.title: #57 - JavaScript Spread Operator - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Master Spread Operator
task.problemStatement: Learn and apply the spread operator (...) to arrays and objects for copying, combining, and destructuring.
task.expectedOutput: Properly spread arrays and objects with correct syntax

challenges.title: Spread Array Elements
challenges.description: Use spread operator to convert an array into individual elements. Pass array elements as separate arguments to a function.

challenges.title: Shallow Copy Arrays
challenges.description: Create a shallow copy of an array using the spread operator. Verify that modifying the copy doesn't affect the original.

challenges.title: Combine with Filtering
challenges.description: Use spread operator to combine arrays and apply filtering conditions in a single operation.

task.title: Iterate Through Arrays
task.problemStatement: Explore different methods to iterate through arrays including forEach, for loop, while loop, and for...of.
task.expectedOutput: Successfully iterate and process all array elements

challenges.title: ForEach with Index
challenges.description: Use forEach() to iterate through an array and log both the element and its index.

challenges.title: Conditional Iteration
challenges.description: Iterate through an array and perform different actions based on element values. Skip elements that don't meet criteria.

challenges.title: Nested Array Iteration
challenges.description: Iterate through a multi-dimensional array and flatten it into a single array using nested loops.

task.problemStatement: Learn how to join arrays into strings and split strings into arrays using appropriate methods.

challenges.title: Join Array with Separator
challenges.description: Convert an array of words into a sentence using join() method with specific separators.

challenges.title: Split and Process String
challenges.description: Split a string by delimiter and process each element to create a formatted output.

challenges.title: CSV Data Processing
challenges.description: Parse CSV data by splitting on commas, process rows, and join them back in different format.

task.title: Sort Arrays in Different Ways
task.problemStatement: Learn to sort arrays of numbers, strings, and objects using the sort() method with custom comparators.
task.expectedOutput: Arrays sorted in ascending, descending, or custom order

challenges.title: Sort Numbers Ascending
challenges.description: Sort an array of numbers in ascending order using a comparison function.

challenges.title: Sort Objects by Property
challenges.description: Sort an array of objects by a specific property (like name or age) in ascending or descending order.

challenges.title: Complex Multi-Level Sorting
challenges.description: Sort an array of objects by multiple criteria. First by one property, then by another if values are equal.

task.title: Test Array Elements
task.problemStatement: Learn to use every() and some() methods to test whether array elements meet specific conditions.
task.expectedOutput: Boolean results from array testing methods

challenges.title: Check All Even Numbers
challenges.description: Use every() to check if all numbers in an array are even. Return true or false.

challenges.title: Check Any Large Value
challenges.description: Use some() to check if at least one element in the array is greater than 100.

challenges.title: Complex Validation Logic
challenges.description: Create a validation function using every() and some() that tests multiple complex conditions on array elements.

videos.title: #62 - Testing Objects in a JavaScript Array (With Examples) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Test Objects in Arrays
task.problemStatement: Apply testing methods (every, some) to arrays of objects with complex property validation.
task.expectedOutput: Boolean results from testing object properties

challenges.title: Verify All Users Active
challenges.description: Check if all user objects in an array have status set to 'active' using every() method.

challenges.title: Find Any Premium Member
challenges.description: Use some() to check if at least one member object has a premium property set to true.

challenges.title: Multi-Property Validation
challenges.description: Test objects with multiple properties and ensure all meet specific criteria across different properties.

videos.title: #63 - Filtering a Javascript Array (With Examples) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Filter Array Elements
task.problemStatement: Use the filter() method to create new arrays containing only elements that meet specific conditions.
task.expectedOutput: New filtered arrays with selected elements

challenges.description: Filter an array of numbers and return only those greater than 50.

challenges.title: Filter Objects by Property
challenges.description: Filter an array of objects and return only items where a specific property matches a condition.

challenges.title: Chain Multiple Filters
challenges.description: Apply multiple filter conditions in sequence to progressively narrow down array elements.

videos.title: #64 - Finding a Javascript Array - find() - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Find Specific Array Elements
task.problemStatement: Learn to use find() and findIndex() methods to locate elements in arrays based on conditions.

challenges.title: Find First Even Number
challenges.description: Use find() to locate the first even number in an array of integers.

challenges.title: Find Index of Object
challenges.description: Use findIndex() to locate the index of an object with a specific property value.

challenges.title: Find with Complex Logic
challenges.description: Find elements using complex conditions involving multiple properties or calculations.

videos.title: #65 - Javascript Arrays: Map() - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Transform Arrays with Map
task.problemStatement: Use the map() method to transform each element of an array into a new value.

challenges.title: Double All Numbers
challenges.description: Create a new array where each number is doubled using map() method.

challenges.title: Extract Object Properties
challenges.description: Use map() to extract a specific property from each object in an array.

challenges.title: Complex Object Transformation
challenges.description: Transform an array of objects into a completely different structure using map() with nested operations.

videos.title: #66 - Javascript Arrays: Chaining Methods - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Chain Multiple Array Methods
task.problemStatement: Combine multiple array methods (map, filter, reduce) in a single chain for efficient data processing.
task.expectedOutput: Final result from chained array operations

challenges.title: Filter and Map Combined
challenges.description: Filter an array to get only numbers above 10, then double each number using method chaining.

challenges.title: Complex Data Pipeline
challenges.description: Chain filter, map, and sort methods to process an array of objects with multiple transformations.

challenges.title: Optimize with Chaining
challenges.description: Take inefficient nested loop code and refactor it using method chaining for better performance.

videos.title: #67 - Javascript Arrays: reduce() Method - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Aggregate Data with Reduce
task.problemStatement: Master the reduce() method to aggregate array elements into a single value or object.

challenges.title: Sum All Array Elements
challenges.description: Use reduce() to calculate the sum of all numbers in an array.

challenges.title: Build Object from Array
challenges.description: Use reduce() to convert an array of key-value pairs into a single object.

challenges.title: Complex Aggregation
challenges.description: Use reduce() with complex logic to group, count, and calculate statistics from array elements.

videos.title: #68 - JavaScript: Difference between sort(), filter(), map(), reduce() methods - (தமிழில்) (Tamil)

task.title: Compare Array Methods
task.problemStatement: Understand when to use sort(), filter(), map(), and reduce() methods for different data processing tasks.
task.expectedOutput: Correct use of each method for specific scenarios

challenges.title: Choose Right Method
challenges.description: For various data processing scenarios, identify which array method (sort/filter/map/reduce) is most appropriate.

challenges.title: Refactor Inefficient Code
challenges.description: Take poorly written data processing code and optimize it by choosing the right combination of methods.

challenges.title: Performance Comparison
challenges.description: Write solutions using different methods and compare their performance and readability.

videos.title: #69 - JavaScript Arrays: Interview Questions (Solution) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Solve Array Interview Problems
task.problemStatement: Practice common array manipulation problems asked in technical interviews.

challenges.title: Find Missing Number
challenges.description: Given an array of n-1 integers from 1 to n, find the missing number efficiently.

challenges.title: Two Sum Problem
challenges.description: Find two numbers in an array that add up to a target sum using optimal approach.

challenges.title: Array Rotation Problem
challenges.description: Rotate an array left or right by k positions without using extra space.

videos.title: #70 - Javascript Functions In-depth - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Master Functions
task.problemStatement: Learn function declarations, expressions, arrow functions, parameters, return values, and scope.

challenges.title: Function Declaration vs Expression
challenges.description: Create functions using both declaration and expression syntax. Understand hoisting differences.

challenges.title: Arrow Functions and This
challenges.description: Write arrow functions and understand how 'this' binding differs from regular functions.

challenges.title: Higher Order Functions
challenges.description: Create functions that return other functions. Practice currying and function composition.

videos.title: #71 - Javascript Function Declaration vs Function Expression - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Understand Function Declaration vs Expression
task.problemStatement: Learn the differences between function declarations and function expressions, including hoisting behavior and use cases.
task.expectedOutput: Correctly identify and use both function declaration and expression patterns

challenges.title: Convert Declaration to Expression
challenges.description: Convert a given function declaration into a function expression. Ensure both versions produce the same output.

challenges.title: Compare Hoisting Behavior
challenges.description: Demonstrate the hoisting difference by calling functions before their definition. Show why declarations work but expressions don't.

challenges.title: Named Function Expression
challenges.description: Create a named function expression and use recursion to show how named expressions can reference themselves.

videos.title: #72 - Javascript Hoisting - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Master Hoisting in JavaScript
task.problemStatement: Understand how JavaScript hoisting works for variables and functions, and predict the behavior of code with hoisting.
task.expectedOutput: Correctly predict hoisting behavior and avoid common pitfalls

challenges.title: Variable Hoisting with var
challenges.description: Demonstrate var hoisting by accessing a variable before its declaration. Show that it returns undefined, not an error.

challenges.title: Function Hoisting
challenges.description: Call a function before its declaration and show that it works correctly due to hoisting.

challenges.title: Temporal Dead Zone with let/const
challenges.description: Explain why accessing let/const before declaration throws ReferenceError (Temporal Dead Zone). Compare with var hoisting.

videos.title: #73 - Javascript Self Invoking Functions - (IIFE) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Create and Use IIFE
task.problemStatement: Learn to create and use Immediately Invoked Function Expressions (IIFE) to create private scopes and avoid global pollution.
task.expectedOutput: IIFE patterns that create private scopes and execute immediately

challenges.title: Create Basic IIFE
challenges.description: Write an IIFE that executes immediately and logs a message without creating global variables.

challenges.title: IIFE with Parameters
challenges.description: Create an IIFE that accepts parameters and returns a value. Show how to pass arguments to an immediately invoked function.

challenges.title: Module Pattern with IIFE
challenges.description: Use IIFE to create a module with private variables and public methods. Demonstrate encapsulation.

videos.title: #74 - Javascript Function Arguments - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Work with Function Arguments
task.problemStatement: Understand how to access and manipulate function arguments using the arguments object and modern approaches.
task.expectedOutput: Properly handle multiple and variable function arguments

challenges.title: Access Arguments Object
challenges.description: Create a function that accepts variable number of arguments and uses the arguments object to sum them.

challenges.title: Arguments vs Parameters
challenges.description: Demonstrate the difference between function parameters (defined in declaration) and arguments (passed at call time).

challenges.title: Convert Arguments to Array
challenges.description: Show multiple ways to convert the arguments object into an array (Array.from(), spread operator, Array.prototype.slice).

videos.title: #75 - Javascript Rest Operator - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Master Rest Operator
task.problemStatement: Learn to use the rest operator (...) to collect multiple arguments into an array parameter.
task.expectedOutput: Functions using rest parameters to handle variable arguments elegantly

challenges.title: Rest Parameters in Function
challenges.description: Create a function that uses rest parameters (...) to accept multiple arguments and process them as an array.

challenges.title: Rest with Regular Parameters
challenges.description: Combine regular parameters with rest parameters. Show that rest must be the last parameter.

challenges.title: Rest in Destructuring
challenges.description: Use rest operator in destructuring assignment to capture remaining elements from arrays or object properties.

videos.title: #76 - Javascript Default Parameters - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Use Default Parameters
task.problemStatement: Learn to set default parameter values in functions to handle missing or undefined arguments.
task.expectedOutput: Functions with sensible default values for optional parameters

challenges.title: Basic Default Parameters
challenges.description: Create a function with default parameter values. Show how they're used when arguments are not provided.

challenges.title: Default with Expressions
challenges.description: Use complex expressions or function calls as default parameter values.

challenges.title: Default Parameters with Objects
challenges.description: Set default values for object destructured parameters. Create functions that accept configuration objects with defaults.

videos.title: #77 - Javascript Getters & Setters - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Implement Getters and Setters
task.problemStatement: Learn to use getter and setter methods to control access to object properties with validation and encapsulation.
task.expectedOutput: Objects with controlled property access through getters and setters

challenges.title: Create Basic Getter
challenges.description: Create an object with a getter that computes a value on-the-fly without storing it as a property.

challenges.title: Setter with Validation
challenges.description: Implement a setter that validates input before assigning it to a property. Throw an error for invalid values.

challenges.title: Encapsulation with Private Variables
challenges.description: Use getters and setters to create private variables with controlled access. Prevent direct modification.

videos.title: #78 - Javascript Error Handling (Try, Throw, Catch) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Handle Errors with Try-Catch
task.problemStatement: Learn to use try-catch-finally blocks to handle errors gracefully and throw custom errors.
task.expectedOutput: Programs that gracefully handle errors and provide meaningful error messages

challenges.title: Basic Try-Catch
challenges.description: Write code with try-catch blocks to handle potential errors without crashing the program.

challenges.title: Throw Custom Errors
challenges.description: Create and throw custom error messages. Catch specific error types and handle them appropriately.

challenges.title: Finally Block Usage
challenges.description: Implement try-catch-finally to ensure cleanup code runs regardless of whether an error occurred.

videos.title: #79 - Javascript Scopes (Global vs Local Scope) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Understand JavaScript Scopes
task.problemStatement: Learn about global scope, local scope, function scope, and block scope in JavaScript.
task.expectedOutput: Code demonstrating proper scope usage and avoiding global scope pollution

challenges.title: Global vs Local Variables
challenges.description: Demonstrate the difference between global and local variables. Show scope shadowing when local and global variables have the same name.

challenges.title: Function Scope
challenges.description: Create nested functions to show how inner functions access variables from outer scopes (lexical scoping).

challenges.title: Block Scope with let and const
challenges.description: Show that let and const have block scope (inside if/for blocks), while var has function scope.

videos.title: #80 - Difference between Javascript var & let keyword - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Compare var, let, and const
task.problemStatement: Understand the differences between var, let, and const in terms of scope, hoisting, and reassignment.
task.expectedOutput: Code using appropriate variable declarations for different scenarios

challenges.title: var Function Scope vs let Block Scope
challenges.description: Demonstrate that var is function-scoped while let is block-scoped. Show loops where this difference matters.

challenges.title: Hoisting Differences
challenges.description: Compare hoisting behavior of var, let, and const. Show undefined initialization vs Temporal Dead Zone.

challenges.title: Const vs let
challenges.description: Explain const immutability for reassignment but not for object/array mutations. Show best practices.

videos.title: #81 - Understanding Javascript 'this' keyword - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Master the this Keyword
task.problemStatement: Understand how this keyword works in different contexts (function, method, constructor, arrow function).
task.expectedOutput: Proper use of this keyword in various JavaScript contexts

challenges.title: this in Method vs Function
challenges.description: Show how this refers to the object when called as a method, but to the global object (or undefined in strict mode) in a regular function.

challenges.title: this in Constructor
challenges.description: Create a constructor function where this refers to the newly created object instance.

challenges.title: Arrow Functions and this Binding
challenges.description: Show that arrow functions don't have their own this, but inherit it from the surrounding scope. Compare with regular functions.

videos.title: #82 - Passing this keyword (Best Practices) - (தமிழில்) (Tamil) | JavaScript Course

task.title: Control this Binding
task.problemStatement: Learn to use call(), apply(), and bind() to explicitly set the this context when calling functions.
task.expectedOutput: Correct use of call, apply, and bind for explicit this control

challenges.title: Using call() and apply()
challenges.description: Use call() and apply() to explicitly set this context. Show the difference between passing single vs multiple arguments.

challenges.title: bind() for Permanent this
challenges.description: Use bind() to create a new function with a permanently bound this context. Show use in event listeners and callbacks.

challenges.title: Practical this Patterns
challenges.description: Implement common patterns like method borrowing, chaining, and fixing this loss in callbacks.

task.problemStatement: Review and consolidate all JavaScript concepts learned throughout the course.

challenges.title: Review: Build a Utility Function Library
challenges.description: Create a collection of utility functions using various JavaScript concepts learned (closures, arrow functions, default parameters, etc.)

challenges.title: Mini Project: Simple OOP Application
challenges.description: Build a mini application using objects, constructors, getters/setters, error handling, and proper this binding.

challenges.title: Code Review Challenge
challenges.description: Review sample code with common mistakes and refactor it using best practices from the entire course.

challenges.title: Mini Calculator
challenges.description: Build a calculator supporting + - * / with edge-case handling and tests.

challenges.title: Memoize and Benchmark
challenges.description: Implement memoize and show performance improvement on an expensive recursive function.

title: JavaScript DOM
description: Learn about HTML DOM using Javascript with in-depth concepts with practical examples. Learn all this free at 4K Ultra HD Quality in cyberdude channel.
